text: AI will be an inevitable way of life like electricity, car, computer, internet and smart phone. Many lost their job due to these new inventions, but many got new opportunities and jobs. Next generation will take AI for granted as current generation take electricity, tab water, internet and smartphone for granted.

text: The fundamental problem here is not AI but Capitalism, which tends to drive wages down and eliminate jobs while rewarding investors and top management. The biggest cost in any business is labor and corporations will reduce this cost however possible which will only further job loss and income inequality. Capitalism is a fine system for those who have some.

name: @maxthemagition
text:
Seeing what has been happening over the last few decades, but especially since 2008, it is clear that the divide bewteen the haves and have nots as well as the difference between the number of those who will benefit and those who will not benefit from this revolution called AI will increase.
Leaving large parts of the World especially those living in cities in deep poverty.
The rise of poverty will increase whilst at the same time the number of very wealthy will decrease.
The top 5% will own 95% of the wealth in the world.
We will see very rich people living in a "Cloud" that cannot be entered by 95% of the people of the World, totally isolated and who own 95% of the riches of the World.
It is already happening, this revolution of sorts....Just find Sothebys auctions Globally and watch in amazement.
Of course this could lead to revolutions and how to prevent revolutions must be uppermost in every Government in every country.
Interesting transition to watch from afar.

name: @KevinSmith-qi5yn
text:
It is interesting that you had on experts that represented different points of view in the micro sense, but in the macro sense only one of them was a capitalist and the others were socialists calling for the redistribution of wealth and the means of production. It even included a nice strawman against Libertarians.
Humans fundamentally don't like doing repetitive tasks. Its why factory work is unpopular. To address this, we created automation in the factory. This increased the productivity of one worker, increased the quality of the end product, and reduced the monotony of the work.
AI right now lacks any creative capacity. It may be able to collage what someone inputs, but it can't come up with its own ideas. When we think about AI like this, then it's more a productivity tool for a workforce that has largely not had productivity gains over the last several decades. If I used Visual Studio CoPilot, I could program ten or more times faster and produce better code. But it's not like AI will know what the entire software is until a person tells it what it is. It reduces the need for coders to rewrite the same code for different clients. This extends into other fields like finance and media art.
With that said, AI means less workers needed within those fields but a higher compensation for those who remain. Right now, the country is grossly lacking in manual labor and many in manual labor fields make salaries competitive with tech workers.
CleanedText: It is interesting that you had on experts that represented different points of view in the micro sense, but in the macro sense only one of them was a capitalist and the others were socialists calling for the redistribution of wealth and the means of production. It even included a nice straw man against Libertarians. Humans fundamentally do not like doing repetitive tasks. It is why factory work is unpopular. To address this, we created automation in the factory. This increased the productivity of one worker, increased the quality of the end product, and reduced the monotony of the work. AI right now lacks any creative capacity. It may be able to collage what someone inputs, but it can not come up with it it is own ideas. When we think about AI like this, then it .more a productivity tool for a workforce that has largely not had productivity gains over the last several decades. If I used Visual Studio Copilot, I could program ten or more times faster and produce better code. But it .not like AI will know what the entire software is until a person tells it what it is. It reduces the need for coders to rewrite the our code for different clients. This extends into other fields like finance and media art. With that said, AI means less workers needed within those fields but a higher compensation for those who remain. Right now, the country is grossly lacking in manual labor and many in manual labor fields make salaries competitive with tech workers.
